Description: This refers to the process of developing a new idea around the possibility of designing an impact bond project to address a particular social/environmental challenge. This cost is often associated with internal staff work.

This refers to the process of developing a business case, which involves searching for evidence on previous similar experiences, assembling and presenting this evidence to other stakeholders, among others.

Some organisations commission a feasibility study before embarking on an impact bond project, or run the feasibility study by themselves. This variable refers to the cost of running any previous assessment to better understand the risks and opportunities associated with the project.
This refers to the cost of legal advice received in the development and design phase of the impact bond project.

This refers to the process of engaging with potential outcomes payers and/or other stakeholders in the market. This cost includes engaging with the government, developing product requirements or specifications, scanning the market for subcontractors, etc.
This refers to the cost of legal advice received in the contract set up stage of the impact bond project.
This refers to the cost of financial advice received in the contract set up stage of the impact bond project.
This refers to the cost of preparing a formal bid, negotiating the formal terms of a contract, going through reference checks and other controls, among others.

Classification: Intervention Delivery costs of service provider(s)
Description: This variable refers to the cost incurred by the service provider(s) in delivering the intervention.

Classification: Intervention Delivery Management by service provider(s)
Description: This variable refers to the management cost of delivering the intervention by service provider(s).

Classification: Performance Management of the service delivery
Description: This variable captures the cost of performance management of the service delivery. This cost is charged to delivery and paid to service provider(s)
This variable records the cost of data collection for the intervention. This cost is paid to the service provider(s).
This variable captures costs to the commissioner in delivering the project. This includes delivery management costs and data collection costs.

Classification: Service delivery costs paid to a management agent, investor or other third part
Description: This variable refers to the service delivery costs paid to a management agent, investor or other third party. Examples include costs associated with supplementary delivery, performance management of delivery and delivery data collection.
This refers to performance bonuses paid to service providers. This cost needs to be treated as additional to the other heads above so as to not duplicate the spend.

Classification: Performance bonuses paid to any other party
Description: This variable refers to performance bonuses paid to other parties generating costs. This cost needs to be treated as additional.

This variable refers to the general organisation costs recharged to the project. Examples of the cost are the proportion of senior management time and for general project management costs such as accounting, audit, bank fees, PbR governance, PbR contracts, insurance, IT, PbR legal costs, unreclaimable tax on general maangement overhead. This cost is paid directly to parties other than service providers.

Classification: General Overhead – Evaluation and dissemination of learning
Description: This variable captures costs associated with evaluating and disseminating learning from the projects. This includes the evaluation, contract cost, and press and social media costs.

Classification: General Overhead - Fixed loan - Transaction and Mobilisation fees
Description: This variable captures the fixed loan for transaction and mobilisation fees.

Classification: General Overhead – Fixed loan - Interest costs
Description: This variable refers to the fixed loan for interest costs.
This variable captures tax that cannot be claimed back.

Classification: SIB Overhead - Data management, validation, and analysis
Description: This variable refers to costs relevant to managing, validating and analysing data by the management agent or, where there is no management agent, by other parties.
This refers to SIB performance management cost that is not part of delivery cost.

Classification: SIB Overhead - Special Purpose Vehicle and SIB management agent
Description: This variable refers to costs associated with the SPV and SIB management agent
This variable captures any other SIB costs incurred.

Classification: SIB Overhead – Investor Transaction and Mobilisation fees
Description: This refers to the cost of investor transaction and mobilisation fees.

Classification: SIB Overhead – Tax on investor returns
Description: This variable refers to costs associated with the tax on investor returns.

Classification: SIB Overhead – Unrecoverable tax on non-delivery SIB cost
Description: This variable captures the tax on non-delivery SIB cost that cannot be claimed back.
This refers to the performance bonuses that were paid for the overhead provision listed above. This needs to be treated as additional to other heads the fund will be pro-rata between SIB/non-SIB.
Other types of cost spent that are not included in the categories above.
